pageContext.description: Dimensions: L 137.2mm; We 73.7mm; Wst 29.2mm; Wbt 19.5mm; L haft 62 & 63; Bfg 15.8mm; Hfg 3.5mm; Tst 12.8mm; Tbt 1.5 (undam. part); Tebev 8.5 & 11; Debev 16.5 & 28,Typology: stop a rounded bump in profile; slightly curved on both faces; defined furrow on one blade face only - on reverse hollowing in this position but no delineated lower bevel; fgs. overhung along haft end; possible longitud. facets on upper sides - v. faint indications; no bl. tip hollows or butt groove; cross-section of lower body with swollen faces.,Manufacture: v. diffuse hmks. on bl. face - more on reverse showing; deliberate embellishment of lower sides; asym. of cutting edge could have been enhanced/created by reworking of broken tip.,Condition: squared bl. tip with smoothed hammered surface same colour as rest - small crack in it suggests likely reshaping after breaking e.; score across one flange not modern; edge not sharp and v. little serrated; butt hammered, prob. recent, forming partial and v. slight lipping; series of scmks. along body and diag. on sides (rev.) and across c.e. - prob. all from  modern cleaning
pageContext.surface: Semi-shiny gold-brown surface; scattered small pocking - concentrated at edge; small parts of crests rubbed to bright gold.
pageContext.site: England,Greater London,River Thames,Putney,Museum register: "From R. Thames at Putney."
pageContext.remarks: Archive: PIF,PRBAF:SI,Ext: CI,Rec. SN Aug 81,Source: MV
